title: Breaking through the publishing glass ceiling: A tribute to my literary agent
description: When her legendary literary agent passed away, Sheridan Prasso went searching for new representation—and found the publishing world's glass ceiling still firmly intact.

title: Travel Essay: Hiking Huangshan helped me conquer the mountain within
description: A solo traveler's nervous arrival at a Huangshan youth hostel becomes the start of an unexpected journey — one where conquering China's legendary Yellow Mountain means facing the doubts of loved ones and the limits within herself.

description: From a Beijing artist who won't call herself feminist to a nude performer healing through dance, four women explore the bold, complicated intersection of art, journalism, and feminism in China and beyond.

description: Meet the unsung journalists behind the headlines: in this debut episode, Alice Xin Liu and Joanna Chiu spotlight Chinese women news assistants who do the legwork but rarely get the byline, while sharing how NüVoices amplifies women's voices in Greater China.

title: NüVoices Podcast #2: China’s #MeToo momentum, with Yuan Yang
description: Explore how #MeToo gained momentum in China despite censorship, as hosts Alice Xin Liu and Joanna Chiu talk with the Financial Times' Yuan Yang about the movement's spread from campuses to the wider world.

title: NüVoices Podcast #3: Meet fantasy writer Mima, who aspires to create China’s Game of Thrones
description: Meet fantasy writer Mima, whose epic novel blends Tarantino's gritty style with Miyazaki's whimsy. Now scripting her series for one of China's biggest streaming platforms, she might just be the next George R. R. Martin.

title: NüVoices Podcast #4: Technology and bias with Christina Larson
description: Join Alice, Sophie, and science journalist Christina Larson as they unpack how technology reinforces gender biases—from China's social credit system to AI—and why women still bear the burden of "fixing" the economy. Plus: their best self-care picks.

title: Shanghai NüVoices discussion salon
description: NüVoices launched in Shanghai with a powerful discussion salon where attendees shared experiences with sexism and brainstormed everyday actions to combat inequality in workplaces and beyond.

title: A NüVoices gathering in Taipei
description: Over three-cup-chicken pizza in Taipei, journalists, artists, and activists gathered for NüVoices' first Taiwan meetup to tackle the questions simmering beneath the surface: Why hasn't #MeToo taken hold here, and why does the world keep overlooking Taiwan?

description: In the same narrow alleys where revolutionaries once plotted to topple a dynasty, Hong Kong's hidden LGBTQ+ spaces quietly thrive. Benita Chick maps the secret bars and stories most locals never see.

description: Meet five female Chinese artists whose striking work challenges the art world's gender imbalance and reveals the cultural forces that shape women into who they become.

description: Join the NüVoices community in Hong Kong for an evening of food, drinks, and spirited conversation—from #MeToo developments in China to podcasting ideas and beyond. All perspectives welcome.

description: From print journalist to live TV veteran, Sophia Yan shares her hard-won tips for nailing broadcast appearances—whether you're staring down the barrel of a camera or chatting with an anchor on set.

title: Loud Murmurs: A feminist Chinese podcast deconstructing US pop culture
description: Growing up in China on Hollywood and Jon Stewart was one thing—learning to question it all was another. Meet the feminist podcast dissecting US pop culture with fresh, critical eyes.

title: Personal Essay by a Chinese adoptee: I returned to China to find my biological family and discover my cultural roots
description: Between two cultures and continents, a Chinese adoptee raised in Quebec returns to her birthplace to search for the biological family she never knew—and the missing piece of her identity.

title: NüVoices Podcast #5: Joan Xu on screenwriting in China
description: From Harvard to Beijing's screenwriting scene, Joan Xu shares her journey crafting action-adventure stories for China-Hollywood co-productions, plus the team celebrates exciting NüVoices launches and swaps self-care picks.

description: NüVoices heads to New York! Join us at Verso Books in Brooklyn for our first North American chapter launch, featuring a powerhouse panel on feminist organizing in China — free entry, drinks, and great community.

title: Translation: Reflections on #MeToo and machismo violence by Peruvian writer Gabriela Wiener
description: Peruvian writer Gabriela Wiener built her reputation exploring sex and identity—until #MeToo transformed her voice into one of fierce resistance. This translation connects her reckoning with machismo to a global wave of women demanding change, from Lima to Beijing.

title: NüVoices Podcast #6: Oral histories and family stories with Karoline Kan
description: Dive into a rich conversation about oral histories, family storytelling, and the art of memoir as writer Karoline Kan shares her journey from personal essays to her debut book, Under Red Skies.

title: Fiction Excerpt: Searching for Gao Meng
description: A young scholar in Nanjing becomes captivated by Ding Ling, a revolutionary writer silenced for exposing how liberation still left women behind—and her obsession opens doors she never expected.

title: Madeleine O'Dea on her memoir The Phoenix Years, Chinese artists and the nation's transformation
description: What does it feel like to live through a nation's rebirth? Madeleine O'Dea follows nine Chinese artists through four decades of hope, creativity, and the ongoing fight for free expression.

title: NüVoices Podcast #7: A rocket maker turned journalist, Lijia Zhang
description: From rocket factory worker to award-winning author, Lijia Zhang's extraordinary journey spans protest, literature, and giving voice to China's "little people." Hear her story on NüVoices Podcast #7.

title: Social: NüVoices London Dinner/Drinks
description: Join NüVoices in London for an evening of dinner, drinks, and lively conversation with fellow China enthusiasts—connect, collaborate, and help shape the future of NüVoices at this intimate Bloomsbury gathering.

title: 100+ attend NüVoices NYC launch and discussion on Chinese feminism
description: Over 100 people packed Verso Books for NüVoices NYC's standing-room-only launch, where an all-female panel tackled Chinese feminism, the Feminist Five, and #MeToo — proving the demand for feminist voices in China scholarship has never been stronger.

title: NüVoices Podcast #8: Eleanor Goodman on the art of translating Chinese poetry
description: Discover how Eleanor Goodman bridges worlds through translating Chinese poetry, from Wang Xiaoni's luminous verses to the raw power of workers' poetry in Iron Moon — plus self-care tips from the hosts.

title: Community: A NüVoices gathering in London
description: From Beijing to London, NüVoices brought together 25+ China watchers, creators, and activists for an evening of bold conversation—on #MeToo, media representation, and building a network that amplifies women's voices across China-related fields.

title: NüVoices Podcast #9: Long-Form Magazine Writing With The New Yorker’s Jiayang Fan
description: Jiayang Fan of The New Yorker joins the NüVoices crew live from Brooklyn to talk immigrant roots, long-form storytelling, and what it means to write about China on your own terms.

title: NüVoices Podcast #10: All-female improv group "Beijing Broads"
description: Meet the Beijing Broads — an all-female improv troupe spanning seven countries — as they riff on comedy, confidence, and getting women to own the stage in this lively episode.

title: Personal Essay by a Chinese daughter: The half-truths we tell in times of sickness
description: A mother calls from the hospital claiming she's seeing a dentist. A daughter promises everything will be fine. Wang Zhen traces the fragile web of half-truths her family wove to shield each other from an unbearable diagnosis.

title: Short Story from a Queer Woman: Tearing
description: A married woman falls for the enigmatic Ostrich in a dizzying cascade of WeChat pings. Alice Xin Liu captures the raw, intoxicating unraveling of desire and identity.

title: Opinion: Why women are leaving Hong Kong tech companies
description: When one woman left her desk at a Hong Kong tech company, the silence lingered for weeks. She wasn't the only one. Athena Lam explores the structural forces driving women out of the city's tech industry.

title: NüYear Drinks in DC - Welcome NüVoices to the US Capital!
description: Ring in the Year of the Pig with NüVoices in DC! Join us for drinks, snacks, and good conversation as we launch our new chapter in the nation's capital—all are welcome.

title: NüVoices and YCW London invites you to our China careers wanel

title: NüVoices of the Diaspora: An evening of storytelling in NYC
description: An evening of storytelling at MOCA featuring Muna Tseng, Alvin Eng, Karoline Kan, and Angel Yau — spanning readings, spoken word, video, and music — plus an open mic inviting audiences to share their own diaspora stories.

title: Meet the queer women organizers of Shanghai's LGBTQ community
description: From opening Shanghai's first lesbian bar to grassroots organizing, four bold women are carving out spaces for visibility, community, and celebration in the city's queer scene.

title: Women experts discuss gender issues and how to build successful China-related careers in London Wanel
description: Three women experts in media, academia, and policy share their China-related career journeys and tackle gender issues at this NüVoices London panel, offering insights for anyone navigating the China-watching world.

title: WATCH: Over 80 attend NüVoices London launch wanel "Being feminist in China: Gender issues across generations"

description: Former NYT reporter and NüVoices board member Karoline Kan traces three generations of Chinese women in her groundbreaking memoir—the first English-language account from a Chinese millennial published in America.

title: DC Event recap: Uyghur women on the ongoing human rights crisis in their homeland

description: From queer women's tech networks in Shanghai to vibrant communities across Taipei and Hong Kong, discover five podcasts that illuminate the rich, diverse tapestry of LGBTQ+ life in Greater China.

description: Kick off summer with NüVoices DC—grab gelato at the Hirshhorn, then explore the stunning Empresses of China exhibit at the Freer & Sackler before an evening of art and celebration at Solstice Saturday.

description: Discover how legal advocates are fighting domestic violence in China—and what happens when new laws make that work harder. Siodhbhra Parkin shares her frontline experiences with host Joanna Chiu.

description: When #MeToo was censored, Chinese feminists created #RiceBunny to keep the movement alive. James Griffiths explores how activists outsmart the Great Firewall to build solidarity against all odds.

description: Meet Zou Shuang, the trailblazing director who became artistic director of the Beijing Music Festival and is reshaping opera for new audiences across China and the UK.

description: Chenni Xu shares hard-won wisdom on navigating corporate culture across continents—from building peer networks to claiming your seat at the table (just not as the note taker).

description: Know a rising star in the China-watching world? Nominate them for the Young China Watcher of the Year Award—celebrating extraordinary contributions to our global understanding of China.

description: Discover why board member Karoline Kan was named 2019 Young China Watcher of the Year—and how her memoir Under Red Skies is reshaping the world's understanding of modern China.

description: Dive into a fascinating conversation with art scholar Xin Wang about contemporary Chinese art, Asian futurism, and techno-orientalism—plus self-care tips from your favorite hosts.

description: MADE IN is a bold new podcast where Asian-Canadian women share stories of identity, beauty standards, and breaking free from the model minority myth—one honest conversation at a time.

description: Author Lijia Zhang drew a packed London crowd with the remarkable story behind her novel Lotus—born from her grandmother's deathbed secret, it puts a human face on China's sex trade.

description: Historian Keisha Brown traces the fascinating, little-known history of Sino-Black relations—from W. E. B. Du Bois and Langston Hughes's ties to China to evolving perceptions of race and identity today.

description: After two decades writing for China's biggest directors, Wu Nan finally stepped behind the camera. She opens up about the long fight for women's voices in Chinese cinema—and why the tide is turning.

description: Ever been caught between two cultures and lost for words? This hilarious Melbourne-made bilingual web series follows a Mandarin interpreter stumbling through wild assignments, turning cultural misunderstandings into comedy gold.

description: Discover how everyday digital giving is reshaping Chinese philanthropy, the women driving non-profit innovation, and what changed when China's foreign NGO law took effect—Emily Weaver shares a decade of insider perspective.

description: Discover how UK-based Hong Kong and British East Asian artists channel the chaos of protest and diaspora into raw, boundary-pushing theatre — a show where nothing is fixed and freedom is still unfolding.

description: Former FT correspondent and Economist Corporate Network director Rachel Morarjee shares insights on championing women in leadership, navigating modern workplaces, and why committing to small daily rituals can transform your well-being.

description: Freelance writer Madeline Leung Coleman talks diaspora identity, punk rock in Chinatown, catching Awkwafina's eye, and what it really takes to build a career in freelance writing and editing.

title: Opinion: In Hong Kong, the government is weaponising sex to downplay its failures
description: Hong Kong's alcohol ban reveals how the government uses sexist narratives and moral panic to deflect from its own policy failures during the coronavirus crisis.

description: Dive into the world of U.S.-China cyber policy with Julia Voo of Harvard's China Cyber Policy Initiative, as she explores digital diplomacy, the Digital Silk Road, and efforts to bridge the cyber divide between two global powers.

description: Discover how women across China and Hong Kong turn trauma into resistance in this stunning documentary that weaves animation, interviews, and archives into a powerful cry for independence.

description: Join award-winning journalist Megha Rajagopalan and Chenni Xu for a transatlantic chat spanning foreign correspondence, Beijing's vanishing hutong culture, and the big question: is the golden age of China reporting really over?

description: From Time Out Beijing to BBC World, Yuan Ren charts her creative leap from print to broadcast journalism — and shares candid advice on thriving in Western media as a woman of Chinese descent.

description: Three leading China-focused communities join forces for a digital summit exploring the pandemic's geopolitical impact through the eyes of journalists, experts, and diaspora writers.

description: From book lists to teaching guides, this collection gathers essential resources for China watchers ready to confront anti-Black racism and build meaningful solidarity with BIPOC communities.

description: Journalist April Zhu reports from Nairobi on gender, urban inequality, and China-Kenya relations — exploring why nuance matters more than Sinophobia or Sinophilia, and how covering women's issues reveals deeper truths about power.

description: In part 2 of this conversation, freelance journalist April Zhu explores Nairobi as a city with a plot, ecosystems of violence, and why the "China-Africa" narrative needs more nuance than simple Sinophobia or Sinophilia.

description: Explore how women and young activists are reshaping China's environmental movement in this dynamic panel with journalist Karoline Kan and climate activist Zongqi Yu, tackling the intersection of gender, policy, and climate change.

description: From a Parisian food blog to the front lines of anti-racism, Grace Ly shares how exploring Asian cuisine unlocked deeper questions of identity, belonging, and visibility for the Asian community in France.

description: Chef Simone Tong of Little Tong Noodle Shop and Silver Apricot opens up about navigating New York's restaurant scene during the pandemic, Chinese culinary identity in America, and the stories behind her food.

description: Yunnan Chen of the Overseas Development Institute joins Cindy to explore China-Africa development finance, fieldwork across the continent, and what it means to navigate Chinese identity as part of the Asian diaspora in the UK.

description: As Black Lives Matter sparks debate in China, members of the country's growing Black community share powerful, candid stories about navigating identity, confronting discrimination, and building solidarity in a place rarely seen through their eyes.

description: When a makeup vlogger's brave confession inspired 720,000 people to break their silence, it exposed a crisis COVID-19 lockdowns would only deepen. Inside China's ongoing battle against domestic violence.

title: NüVoices Podcast #45: An uncertain future with guaranteed friction: U.S.-China economic coercion, with Ashley Feng
description: Dive into a revealing conversation about U.S.-China economic coercion with researcher Ashley Feng, as she and NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu unpack how tariffs and restrictions impact everyday people—from students to scientists—and what lies ahead post-election.

description: When a cancer diagnosis upends her life, a journalist labeled "leftover" by Chinese society embarks on a journey that's equal parts sharp social critique and warmly human comedy.

title: NüVoices Podcast #46: Retail and e-commerce boom and bust in mainland and Hong Kong during COVID-19, with Tiffany Ap
description: Discover how China's fashion and retail industries roared back to life post-lockdown, why e-commerce livestreaming exploded, and what caused Hong Kong's retail collapse—plus a viral #MeToo moment—with WWD China bureau chief Tiffany Ap.

description: A young Guangzhou theatre troupe transforms ordinary offices into stages where strangers share their most vulnerable stories—and watch them become raw, improvised art.

description: From Alipay's global expansion to the future of digital money, Rita Liu shares her fintech war stories with Chenni Xu—plus why gender representation in finance still matters.

title: NüVoices Podcast #48: U.S.-Taiwan relations: From Trump to Biden
description: Experts Margaret Lewis and Jessica Drun join host Joanna Chiu from Taipei to unpack a pivotal shift in U.S.-Taiwan policy — what Pompeo's move means, why reactions are divided, and what comes next under Biden.

title: Virtual events for Te-Ping Chen's story collection, Land of Big Numbers
description: Discover the buzz around NüVoices community member Te-Ping Chen's stunning debut collection, hailed as "gripping and illuminating" — plus details on virtual book launch events you won't want to miss.

title: NüVoices Podcast #49: Walking through development mandalas in the eastern Tibetan Plateau, with Pamela Logan
description: Dr. Pamela Logan shares her 14-year journey running a foundation in the eastern Tibetan Plateau — exploring education, healthcare, women's resilience, and what it truly takes to sustain compassion across borders.

title: NüVoices Podcast #50: Directing "Finding Yingying", with Jenny Shi
description: Jenny Shi takes us behind the scenes of her award-winning documentary Finding Yingying—sharing the creative highs, emotional toll, and the unforgettable story that captivated audiences worldwide.

title: Review: Te-Ping Chen's "Land of Big Numbers" sketches the diversity of modern China
description: What happens when a journalist turns to fiction? Te-Ping Chen's debut collection moves beyond China's headlines to sketch the rich inner lives of individuals you won't soon forget.

title: Translation: Poems by Chinese feminist and revolutionary writer Qiu Jin
description: Discover the fierce, lyrical voice of Qiu Jin—a trailblazing Chinese feminist and revolutionary whose poems, translated by Yilin Wang, blazed with defiance and a radical vision for women's liberation over a century ago.

title: Resources to fight anti-East, Southeast Asian & Pacific Islander racism
description: Discover a vital, continuously updated collection of resources for combating anti-East, Southeast Asian & Pacific Islander racism—from grassroots organizations to bystander intervention tips.

description: From ancient Song Dynasty acrobatics to modern fitness studios, pole dancing in China is rewriting its own history—and challenging everything you thought you knew about the sport.

title: NüVoices Podcast #52: Talking fiction writing and modern China, with Te-Ping Chen
description: Discover how Te-Ping Chen transformed her years as a Wall Street Journal correspondent in China into vivid fiction, and hear her insights on modern China, journalism-to-fiction skills, and breaking into publishing.

description: A Black American lawyer heads to 1940s Shanghai seeking the opportunities denied him at home—and finds himself caught in a world of intrigue on the eve of Pearl Harbor. Amy Sommers shares the forgotten history behind her riveting debut novel.

title: NüVoices Podcast #54: Telling Asian and Asian-American stories through video journalism, with Dolly Li
description: From award-winning video journalist Dolly Li—former host of AJ+'s Untold America and co-founder of Goldthread—a rich conversation on visual storytelling, documenting multi-generational Asian-American experiences, and navigating identity across borders.

title: Young China Watchers event: A Discussion of LGBTQ+ Progress and Activism in China
description: Three experts explore the evolving landscape of LGBTQ+ rights in China and Hong Kong, from workplace inclusion to marriage equality, examining both hard-won victories and the barriers that remain.

title: NüVoices Podcast #55: Unraveling Australia-China relations, with Natasha Kassam
description: Former Australian diplomat Natasha Kassam joins NüVoices chair Joanna Chiu to unpack how Australia went from one of China's closest Western partners to a flashpoint in Beijing's deteriorating global relations—and why the fallout hits Chinese-Australians hardest.

title: Introducing: The 异乡人 (Yi Xiang Ren) podcast featuring immigrant stories
description: Discover 异乡人 (Yi Xiang Ren), a Mandarin-language podcast sharing the deeply personal journeys of Chinese immigrants worldwide—their joys, losses, hopes, and the universal search for belonging across borders.

title: NüVoices Podcast #56: Censorship and resistance, with Sophie Beach
description: What does it take to bring uncensored Chinese voices to the world? Sophie Beach of China Digital Times joins Cindy to discuss evolving censorship tactics and the persistent resistance of China's netizens.

title: NüVoices Podcast #57: Revolutionary feminism, wuxia, and the politics of translation, with Yilin Wang
description: Dive into a rich conversation about revolutionary feminist poetry, wuxia literature, and the complex politics of Chinese-English translation with writer and translator Yilin Wang.

description: Step inside a forgotten chapter of British-Chinese history through 97 rare artefacts from archives worldwide. Curator Iris Yau's 'Silk Route' exhibition at SOAS reveals hidden stories of opium, silk, and missionaries—plus a live discussion you won't want to miss.

description: NüVoices podcast co-host Cindy Gao shares her approach to audio storytelling—from prepping guests to finding the unasked questions that reveal the most compelling stories.

description: Anchored by NüVoices board member Sophia Yan, this gripping four-part Telegraph podcast explores how Hong Kong's National Security Law has transformed daily life—told through the voices of those living it.

title: NüVoices Podcast #59: COVID-19 origins and the state of science reporting in China, with Kathleen McLaughlin
description: Science reporter Kathleen McLaughlin and NüVoices' Rui Zhong unpack COVID-19 origin theories and what China's history with HIV and the CRISPR scandal reveals about the state of science journalism in the country.

title: NüVoices Podcast #60: Getting tea drunk, with Shunan Teng

description: Discover how Queer East Film Festival is spotlighting bold queer storytelling from across Asia, with 37 films from 15 countries that bridge cultures and amplify voices too often left out of the conversation.

description: Queer China UK is seeking applicants for its Transnational Chinese Queer Leadership Programme—a four-month mentorship pairing you with international activists, professors, and LGBTQ+ leaders to build community and drive change across borders.

description: Wang Lina's debut follows two Uyghur children facing wrenching goodbyes in Xinjiang. But in a region under unprecedented surveillance, even a tender coming-of-age story carries political weight.

description: What does it mean to be a feminist in contemporary China? This bold collection reveals the diverse movements, voices, and struggles reshaping gender and power beyond a single narrative.

title: LONDON PANEL: "China Unbound" book launch with author Joanna Chiu, in conversation with Megha Rajagopalan

description: Shen Yang grew up hidden, shuttled between relatives as an "illegal" second daughter under China's one-child policy. In this moving conversation, she shares her journey from secret childhood to powerful memoirist.

description: Dive into Crystal Tai's fascinating journey as a non-visible "foreign correspondent" in East Asia—from infiltrating K-pop academies to exploring Mongolia's street style—plus her book on South Korea's solo-lifestyle movement.

description: From billionaires to supply chains to career reinvention, business reporter Hope King unpacks the forces shaping global markets—and shares her own journey from Wall Street to the anchor desk as a Chinese American journalist.

description: Journalist Katie Stallard explores how China, Russia, and North Korea weaponize WWII narratives to shape their futures, drawing on her book *Dancing on Bones* in this live conversation with NüVoices founder Joanna Chiu.

description: NPR Beijing correspondent Emily Feng joins NüVoices to share stories from reporting in Ukraine and Xinjiang, her path from freelancer to foreign correspondent, and the viral snail noodle controversy you didn't know you needed to hear about.

description: From backpacking through China's provinces to writing a landmark book on Taiwanese cuisine, Clarissa Wei shares her journey in food journalism, thoughts on authenticity in diasporic cooking, and passion for elevating Taiwanese stories to global audiences.

description: What happens when a son returns to rural China to search for his missing father? Belinda Huijuan Tang discusses her stunning debut A Map for the Missing and the family stories that inspired it.

description: What drives Xi Jinping's obsession with control? Sue-Lin Wong traces his journey from Cultural Revolution trauma to an unprecedented third term, plus the drama behind Hu Jintao's shocking exit.

description: Discover how Yaxue Cao built ChinaChange.org into a vital bridge between Chinese civil society and the world, amplifying the voices of human rights defenders and those working to effect change from within.

description: Discover how British-Chinese writer Ysabelle Cheung navigates identity, belonging, and the expat experience through poetry and prose that cuts straight to the bone of diaspora life.

description: Dive into the first episode of our Taiwan mini-series, where Yu-Jie Chen delivers a brilliantly clear summary of 300 years of Taiwanese history and explores how cross-strait tensions are reshaping identity and politics on the island.

title: Our 100th Podcast Episode Special! Remembering Coco Lee, Janet Yellen's Visit to China, and More
description: Celebrate 100 episodes of the NüVoices podcast as hosts Megan, Solarina, and Sophia reunite for a wide-ranging conversation—from tributes to Coco Lee and Janet Yellen's Beijing visit to the joys of Never Have I Ever.

title: A Chinese drama is sparking debates about sexual harassment and victim-blaming culture
description: A star-studded Chinese drama about workplace rape has ignited fierce debate—why are so many viewers siding with the powerful boss over his young assistant?

title: NüVoices Podcast #101: Adapting YA bestseller 'Loveboat, Taipei' to the big screen with Abigail Hing Wen
description: Abigail Hing Wen takes us inside Taiwan's legendary "Love Boat" summer program and how she turned its wild, heartfelt stories into a NYT bestselling YA novel—and now a film bringing diaspora youth culture to the big screen.

title: LONDON EVENT: Ian Johnson in Conversation with Zhang Lijia on 'Sparks'
description: Pulitzer Prize-winner Ian Johnson joins NüVoices board member Zhang Lijia for a compelling conversation about *Sparks*—his riveting account of China's underground historians fighting to preserve memory against state-led forgetting.

title: NüVoices Podcast #102: A Conversation with Yun-Ching Ko about the Taiwan Innocence Project
description: Discover how Yun-Ching Ko and the Taiwan Innocence Project are fighting to free the wrongfully convicted—exploring real cases, systemic reform, and what justice truly means in Taiwan's evolving legal landscape.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #103: Julia Lovell on China's Hidden Century, an exhibit at The British Museum
description: Scholar Julia Lovell pulls back the curtain on The British Museum's groundbreaking Hidden Century exhibition, revealing a Qing dynasty brimming with creativity far beyond its turbulent reputation.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #104: Clarissa Wei and Ivy Chen on their new cookbook, Made in Taiwan
description: Journalist Clarissa Wei and chef Ivy Chen dive into the stories behind their celebrated cookbook Made in Taiwan—exploring identity, Indigenous and Hakka influences, and why Taiwanese food is so much more than what meets the eye.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #105: Bethany Allen-Ebrahimian on her new book, Beijing Rules
description: Dive into this eye-opening conversation with Axios China reporter Bethany Allen-Ebrahimian as she reveals how Beijing wields economic power to shape global behavior—and what democracies can do to push back.

title: Tears of Salt: Review of 'Salt Town' by Yi Xiaohe
description: A viral poem once promised a cultural breakthrough for rural Chinese women. Yi Xiaohe's Salt Town strips away that optimism, exposing how poverty, neglect, and deep gender imbalance persist in the villages progress forgot.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #106: Taiwan's LGBTQ History with Wen Liu
description: Discover how Taiwan became Asia's trailblazer for LGBTQ rights. Scholar Wen Liu joins Sophia Yan to trace the movement's origins from the post-martial law era to the landmark legalization of same-sex marriage—and the challenges still ahead.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #107: Pearl Low on their platform, Cantonese Connection, and heritage language learning
description: Why is learning your family's language so hard? Artist Pearl Low shares their journey and how their platform Cantonese Connection is creating welcoming, judgment-free spaces for heritage language learners.

title: NüVoices Podcast x Ghost Island Media Panel:  Covering Taiwan, Centering Local Perspectives, with Silva Shih, Afore Hsieh, Wen-Yee Lee, and Emily Y. Wu
description: What happens when global attention turns to Taiwan? Four Taipei-based journalists explore why local perspectives are essential to understanding the island's story — and what gets lost when they're left out of the conversation.

title: NüProfile: Fiona Sze-Lorrain on creativity and her debut novel "Dear Chrysanthemums"
description: Poet, translator, and musician Fiona Sze-Lorrain opens up about her Carnegie-longlisted debut novel — a tapestry of interconnected stories following Chinese and Asian women navigating trauma, identity, and exile across Shanghai, Paris, and New York.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #108: #MeToo in Taiwan, a Conversation with Darice Chang and Rita Jhang
description: Six months after a Facebook post ignited Taiwan's #MeToo movement, Darice Chang and Rita Jhang join us to unpack its origins, its ripple effects across society, and how feminism, intersectionality, and the upcoming election are shaping what comes next.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #109: 'How to Have an American Baby' with documentary filmmaker Leslie Tai
description: Discover the hidden world of birth tourism in Southern California as filmmaker Leslie Tai joins Solarina Ho to discuss her documentary's intimate look at the mothers, the shadow economy, and the complex human stories behind "How to Have an American Baby."

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #110: Feminist Activism Then & Now, a Conversation with Wanqing Zhang, Lijia Zhang & Jessie Lau
description: Explore the evolution of China's feminist movement with journalists Wanqing Zhang, Lijia Zhang, and Jessie Lau as they discuss how digital activists are creatively resisting censorship and patriarchal norms on platforms like Xiaohongshu.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #111: A Conversation with Fuchsia Dunlop about her book, "Invitation to a Banquet"
description: Fuchsia Dunlop joins host Lijia Zhang to explore her sweeping book on Chinese culinary culture—from mythical origins to modern kitchens—revealing how every dish tells a story of history, politics, and everyday life.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #112: Leta Hong Fincher on the 10th Anniversary Edition of her book, Leftover Women
description: A decade after shaking up conversations about Chinese feminism, Leta Hong Fincher revisits "Leftover Women" with host Jessie Lau—exploring why the pressure on women to marry has only intensified under Xi's China.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #113: Illustrator Kaitlin Chan on her graphic novel, 'Eric's Sister'
description: What happens when you feel like a supporting actor in your own life? Cartoonist Kaitlin Chan joins us to discuss her Hong Kong-set graphic novel 'Eric's Sister,' a story of sibling bonds, creative doubt, and finding your own path in the arts.

title: NüVoices in Perugia: The rise and transformation of women's magazines and platforms
description: Young women's magazines have transformed from beauty bibles into powerful platforms for social change. Watch NüVoices, Teen Vogue, and gal-dem discuss how they're amplifying marginalized voices and building communities hungry for progress.

title: NüVoices Podcast #114: Indigenous culture, politics and activism in Taiwan, a Conversation with Tuhi Martukaw
description: Tuhi Martukaw opens up about reconnecting with her Indigenous roots in Taiwan, challenging misconceptions, and building a movement for recognition — a powerful conversation on identity, activism, and what reconciliation really means today.

title: NüVoices Podcast #115: UBC Students Podcast Special! Yi Chien Jade Ho on Anti-Gentrification Activism in Vancouver's Chinatown and Judith Shapiro on Environmentalism in China
description: In this special UBC collaboration, hear Yi Chien Jade Ho discuss anti-gentrification activism in Vancouver's Chinatown and Judith Shapiro explore China's environmental movement—two vital conversations at the intersection of rights, place, and power.

title: Book excerpt: Kate Whitehead's 'Pandemic Minds' explores mental health in Hong Kong
description: Behind Hong Kong's strict pandemic walls, 40 people share raw stories of anxiety, isolation, and resilience—reminding us that healing begins when we finally talk about it.

title: NüVoices 2024 Global Updates / Wrap
description: Catch up on everything NüVoices accomplished this year—from new podcast episodes and magazine pieces to global journalism conferences—and see exactly how your donations fuel this volunteer-driven community.

title: Past, present and poetry: Hong Kong filmmaker Ann Hui’s 'July Rhapsody'
description: What happens when the poetry you teach starts speaking your truth? Ann Hui's July Rhapsody is a luminous portrait of midlife longing, regret, and the quiet unraveling of a steady life.

title: Fiction: A Long Walk Through the Tall Dry Grass
description: In wartime Guangdong, a twelve-year-old girl tends her family's farm and dreams of city life—until two strangers arrive and her mother faces an unthinkable choice.

title: NüProfile: Jih-E Peng on cinematography and the creative process
description: What drives a cinematographer to put story above stunning visuals? Jih-E Peng opens up about creative collaboration, her roots in photography, and her latest feature, Girls Will Be Girls.

title: LONDON PANEL: Navigating Feminist Organising in ESEA communities
description: Explore the vital intersections of feminism, solidarity, and community building through the lens of East and Southeast Asian experiences at this dynamic London panel hosted by Moongate Productions.

title: NüVoices Podcast #116: Model Minority Gone Rogue, a Conversation with Qin Qin
description: Host Chenni Xu chats with Qin Qin about her memoir on ditching the "model minority" script—from overachieving ex-lawyer to living life on her own terms—plus book recs and self-care tips that might surprise you.

title: Memoir excerpt: Model Minority Gone Rogue by Qin Qin
description: The net kept getting higher, the expectations more impossible. In this sharp, revelatory memoir excerpt, Qin Qin traces what happens when a tiger mother's daughter finally stops playing by everyone else's rules.

title: Encore: Chinese Canadian Immigrant Histories with Arlene Chan and Melanie Ng
description: Historians Arlene Chan and Melanie Ng trace the arc of Chinese Canadian migration—from 19th-century pioneers to present-day challenges—alongside Sheila's powerful firsthand account of fleeing the Chinese Civil War.

title: EVENT: NüVoices Virtual Workshop Series |  Freelance Writing and Pitching with Suyin Haynes and Jessie Lau
description: Level up your freelance writing game in this 90-minute virtual workshop with journalists Suyin Haynes and Jessie Lau, covering everything from crafting standout pitches to catching editors' attention in today's competitive media landscape.

title: 2025 NüStories Essay Contest
description: Discover the winning essays from NüStories' first annual personal essay contest exploring Chinese identity—featuring powerful creative nonfiction by underrepresented writers from around the world.

title: Reflections on a light show
description: Two writers, one photograph, one rule: never share a word until it's done. Their twinned reflections on a James Turrell light installation in wintry Beijing shimmer with memory, cold, and the golden haze of youth slipping away.

title: NüVoices Podcast #117: A Career in Foreign Correspondence and Podcasting, a Conversation with Jane Perlez
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Jane Perlez shares stories from decades of foreign correspondence across four continents and reveals why she's now all-in on podcasting with her US-China show.

title: NüVoices Podcast #118: Scam Inc. from The Economist, a Conversation with Sue-Lin Wong
description: Sue-Lin Wong reveals the staggering world behind *Scam Inc.*—from human trafficking to a global gig economy of fraud. A fascinating conversation on how online scams became a multi-billion dollar industry hiding in plain sight.

title: EVENT: NüVoices Virtual Workshop Series | Transforming Memory into Story with Karen Cheung
description: We all carry stories that resist being written. Join author Karen Cheung to unlock your personal archives—diaries, photos, old chats—and transform raw memory into powerful nonfiction.

title: NüVoices Podcast #119: Let Only Red Flowers Bloom, a Conversation with Emily Feng
description: Emily Feng joins NüVoices to discuss her powerful new book exploring identity and belonging in Xi Jinping's China—from Xinjiang to Inner Mongolia—and why revealing the human side of these stories matters most.

title: Meet Our New Podcast Production Team
description: Get to know Rebecca Liu and Wing Kuang, the newest members of the NüVoices podcast team — and discover how our podcast continues to launch careers in journalism.

title: Podcast Crossover: Feminist Rebels from Face-Off: the U.S. vs China with Jane Perlez
description: Dive into this special crossover episode exploring China's feminist rebels—from "leftover women" defying tradition to activists challenging inequality—featuring Leta Hong Fincher and hosts Jane Perlez and Rana Mitter.

title: Chinese women use hashtags like "baby food" to shield from sexist men, but remain vulnerable to abuse
description: Chinese women invented clever code words to create safe online spaces away from sexist trolls. But as platforms like Xiaohongshu court male users, even coded language can't keep them safe.

title: NüVoices Podcast #120: How I Stopped Being a Model Minority with Anne Anlin Cheng
description: Explore how Anne Anlin Cheng moved from academic scholarship to deeply personal writing, unpacking the model minority myth, interracial intimacy, and finding "ordinary faith" amid life's crises.

title: Memoir excerpt: Chinese Parents Don't Say I Love You
description: Two young sisters become luncheon meat experts in 1990s Sydney, filling their own stomachs while their mother can't leave bed. Candice Chung's memoir is tender, funny, and achingly real.

title: "You need glasses for Asian faces."
description: A casual remark at the optician's sparks a wry, prize-winning meditation on nose bridges, Blu Tack hacks, and what it really means to have "an Asian face."

title: What You Know (And Didn't Know)
description: At seven, he knew what death was but couldn't cry at his grandmother's funeral. A prize-winning essay on the grief we carry before we have words for it.

title: Chinese Female Stand-Up Comedians and their Prisoner's Dilemma
description: When a Chengdu comedian joked about menstruation on stage, the audience went silent. For China's female stand-up comics, every punchline is a defiant act—and a calculated risk.

title: In queer diaspora, my fear leaks through
description: A dreamlike personal essay where birthday celebrations blur with snowfall in the wrong season, childhood friends appear out of place, and the simple act of walking home becomes an aching metaphor for the distances diaspora creates between who we are and where we belong.

title: Mother Tongue
description: What does it mean to be Chinese when you're born between East and West? Kim Gordon untangles identity, diaspora, and belonging across continents and generations.

title: A trip to the supermarket
description: What happens when you can no longer write your own Chinese name? In this award-winning personal essay, N.J. Chan navigates identity, belonging, and the bittersweet complexity of life between cultures.

title: I am a Midwestern Chinese Girl
description: Growing up Chinese in Iowa meant Saturday Chinese school, mom's home cooking, and endless farmland that echoed her ancestors' roots half a world away. Jenna Wang's prize-winning essay explores identity, belonging, and the beautiful contradictions of a Midwestern Chinese girlhood.

title: I work in US policy – being Chinese is now an occupational hazard
description: What happens when your colleague labels Chinese researchers as "spies"—and you're half-Chinese yourself? A policy analyst's powerful reckoning with identity in the crosshairs of US-China tensions.

title: 'Beauty Queen': Excerpt from Anne Anlin Cheng's Memoir 'Ordinary Disasters'
description: What happens when beauty is your family's currency—but you feel like the one left out? Anne Anlin Cheng traces its weight across generations in this luminous memoir excerpt.

title: NüProfile: Amy Ng on playwriting and her show 'Shanghai Dolls' - a feminist retelling of famous female figures in the Cultural Revolution
description: Two penniless actresses meet at a Shanghai audition—one becomes China's first female director, the other Madame Mao. Amy Ng reveals the untold story behind their extraordinary bond.

title: NüVoices Podcast #121: Wenchi Yu, a Career in Diplomacy, Influence and Impact
description: From the US Congress to the State Department to Goldman Sachs, Wenchi Yu has built bridges across cultures and sectors. She joins us to explore identity, diplomacy, and the evolving US-China-Taiwan landscape through her remarkable career.

title: Book Excerpt: 'Chinese And Any Other Asian' by Anna Sulan Masing
description: What happens when your body becomes public property? In this powerful excerpt from *Chinese And Any Other Asian*, Anna Sulan Masing explores the brutal intersection of race, gender, and desire—and what it means to be deemed the "right type of exotic."

title: Beijing International Film Festival brings Chinese films to a UK audience
description: The Beijing International Film Festival brought award-winning Chinese cinema to London—and we got a front-row seat. Here's your guide to the standout films.

title: Exhibition: Ways of Remembering Hong Kong
description: Through artifacts, oral histories, and an interactive memory map, "Ways of Remembering" transforms a London gallery into a powerful act of collective resistance—inviting Hongkongers and allies to preserve the stories that authorities want erased.

title: Essay by a Manchu girl in Tibet: Finding My Chinese Identity
description: A Manchu student's journey from a childhood slur in Yangzhou to house arrest at university becomes a bold, deeply personal reckoning with what it truly means to belong in China.

title: Book Excerpt: 'I Am Not a Tourist' by Daisy J. Hung
description: She walked 6,000 miles from China to Britain on bound feet. Discover the extraordinary, untold stories of Chinese women in Britain in this exclusive excerpt from Daisy J. Hung's 'I Am Not a Tourist.'

title: NüVoices Podcast #122: Sonalie Figueiras, Demystifying Eco-Living and Sustainability Myths
description: Tiffany Ap sits down with Sonalie Figueiras, founder of Green Queen and Asia's leading sustainability voice, to bust eco-living myths, explore the region's climate and food tech boom, and ask: are we finally turning the tide on overconsumption?

title: NüVoices Podcast #Special: Amanda Hsiao, on Trump 2.0 and Beijing’s new tactics
description: Dive into this special episode where Sophia Yan and Eurasia Group's Amanda Hsiao unpack Trump 2.0's China strategy, Beijing's evolving responses, and what escalating trade wars mean for the world's most consequential relationship.

title: Homecoming at the Cemetery
description: A writer carries a heart-shaped stone across the Pacific to honor her mother at a misty Taiwanese cemetery, tracing three generations of family roots through grief, memory, and homecoming.

title: Living in London, Belonging Nowhere
description: On a rainy London bus, listening to a podcast about Xi Jinping, one writer confronts the strange ache of building a life in a city that will never quite feel like home.
